headline: Google & Amazon join Trump admin's AI-powered 'Genesis mission'
summary: Yahoo Finance Senior Producer John Hyland tracks Thursday's top moving stocks and biggest market stories in this Market Minute. Amazon (AMZN), Google (GOOG, GOOGL), Nvidia (NVDA), Palantir (PLTR), and other companies are partnering with the Trump administration on its new "Genesis mission." Lululemon (LULU) is facing activist investor pressure from Elliott Investment Management, which recently took a $1 billion stake in the retailer. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

Yahoo Finance Senior Producer John Hyland tracks Thursday's top moving stocks and biggest market stories in this Market Minute.

Amazon (AMZN), Google (GOOG, GOOGL), Nvidia (NVDA), Palantir (PLTR), and other companies are partnering with the Trump administration on its new "Genesis mission."

Lululemon (LULU) is facing activist investor pressure from Elliott Investment Management, which recently took a $1 billion stake in the retailer.

Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: Lighter Inflation Number Cheers Stock Investors
summary: Stocks climbed and bond yields held on to early declines after the delayed consumer-price index for November showed prices rose 2.7% in the past 12 months, slowing from a 3% rate in September.  Shares of consumer companies and big tech firms led gains in the S&P 500, which rose 0.8%, breaking a four-session losing streak.  Amazon.com  added 2.5%, while  Nvidia  climbed 1.9% and the Dow industrials broke their own four-day losing streak with a 0.1% gain.

content.title: Lighter Inflation Number Cheers Stock Investors
content.summary: Stocks climbed and bond yields held on to early declines after the delayed consumer-price index for November showed prices rose 2.7% in the past 12 months, slowing from a 3% rate in September.  Shares of consumer companies and big tech firms led gains in the S&P 500, which rose 0.8%, breaking a four-session losing streak.  Amazon.com  added 2.5%, while  Nvidia  climbed 1.9% and the Dow industrials broke their own four-day losing streak with a 0.1% gain.

headline: Stocks rise as US inflation cools, tech stocks bounce

headline: GE Vernova Stock Recovers as the AI Trade Rebounds
summary: GE Vernova  was making a comeback Thursday, after a very bad day the previous session.  The drop appeared to be catalyzed by artificial-intelligence chip start-up Mythic, which recently raised $125 million to take on  Nvidia  The start-up is trying to design AI chips that solve “the biggest problem of AI—its insatiable, ruinous energy consumption,” according to Mythic.  In theory, lower energy consumption means less electricity needed and fewer AI business opportunities for GE Vernova.

content.title: GE Vernova Stock Recovers as the AI Trade Rebounds

In theory, lower energy consumption means less electricity needed and fewer AI business opportunities for GE Vernova.

headline: Micron Earnings ‘Best’ in Chip History After Nvidia. How Its Stock Became the New AI Darling.
summary: Micron  Technology earnings are out—and the AI trade may be back on track.  Micron Technology stock surged Thursday, the day after the memory chip maker reported better-than-expected earnings results and gave guidance that was significantly higher than expectations.  For the current quarter, Micron forecast a revenue range with a midpoint of $18.7 billion, above analysts’ expectations of $14.3 billion.

content.title: Micron Earnings ‘Best’ in Chip History After Nvidia. How Its Stock Became the New AI Darling.
content.summary: Micron  Technology earnings are out—and the AI trade may be back on track.  Micron Technology stock surged Thursday, the day after the memory chip maker reported better-than-expected earnings results and gave guidance that was significantly higher than expectations.  For the current quarter, Micron forecast a revenue range with a midpoint of $18.7 billion, above analysts’ expectations of $14.3 billion.

headline: There’s No Quick Fix for Soaring Health Insurance Costs. These Accounts Can Help.
summary: More Americans may turn to health savings accounts as insurance premiums are set to soar next year for millions of consumers.  The accounts, known as HSAs, may be used for a variety of medical expenses, and the new tax law expanded their footprint.  Health insurance premiums are set to more than double next year, on average, for more than 20 million Americans enrolled in coverage through the Affordable Care Act.

content.title: There’s No Quick Fix for Soaring Health Insurance Costs. These Accounts Can Help.
content.summary: More Americans may turn to health savings accounts as insurance premiums are set to soar next year for millions of consumers.  The accounts, known as HSAs, may be used for a variety of medical expenses, and the new tax law expanded their footprint.  Health insurance premiums are set to more than double next year, on average, for more than 20 million Americans enrolled in coverage through the Affordable Care Act.

headline: Lovable valued at $6.6 billion in latest funding round as AI coding demand surges
summary: AI software development startup Lovable said on Thursday it raised $330 million in an early-stage funding ​round that values the Stockholm-based company at $6.6 billion. Alphabet's CapitalG and ‌Menlo Ventures led the round, which nearly quadruples Lovable's valuation in less than ‌six months. The deal also drew investment from Nvidia's venture capital arm among others, underscoring investor demand for agentic AI tools that can handle complex software development work with minimal human input, as ⁠enterprises and hobbyists increasingly ‌adopt AI-assisted coding.

content.title: Lovable valued at $6.6 billion in latest funding round as AI coding demand surges
content.summary: AI software development startup Lovable said on Thursday it raised $330 million in an early-stage funding ​round that values the Stockholm-based company at $6.6 billion. Alphabet's CapitalG and ‌Menlo Ventures led the round, which nearly quadruples Lovable's valuation in less than ‌six months. The deal also drew investment from Nvidia's venture capital arm among others, underscoring investor demand for agentic AI tools that can handle complex software development work with minimal human input, as ⁠enterprises and hobbyists increasingly ‌adopt AI-assisted coding.

Broadcom stock is also on the rise after shedding roughly $422 billion of its market cap over the last five trading days.

headline: OpenAI has discussed raising tens of billions at about $750 billion valuation: The Information
summary: OpenAI has held preliminary talks with some investors about raising funds at a ​valuation of around $750 billion, the Information reported ‌on Wednesday.  Reuters could not immediately verify the report and OpenAI did not immediately respond to a request for comment.  If finalized, ⁠the talks would represent ‌a roughly 50% jump from OpenAI's reported $500 billion valuation in October, following a deal ‍in which current and former employees sold about $6.6 billion worth of shares.

content.title: OpenAI has discussed raising tens of billions at about $750 billion valuation: The Information
content.summary: OpenAI has held preliminary talks with some investors about raising funds at a ​valuation of around $750 billion, the Information reported ‌on Wednesday.  Reuters could not immediately verify the report and OpenAI did not immediately respond to a request for comment.  If finalized, ⁠the talks would represent ‌a roughly 50% jump from OpenAI's reported $500 billion valuation in October, following a deal ‍in which current and former employees sold about $6.6 billion worth of shares.

headline: From OpenAI to DeepSeek, Nvidia's biggest moments from 2025
summary: 2025 was another big year for AI, and as fast as the year flew by, investors won't forget these major moments for semiconductor manufacturer Nvidia (NVDA). Yahoo Finance tech editor Dan Howley comes on Market Domination to talk about the chipmaker's biggest moments throughout 2025, from the competition that China's DeepSeek AI model posed and its strategic partnership with OpenAI (OPAI.PVT). Also catch Yahoo Finance's interview with author Stephen Witt about his latest book on Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang and the chief executive's vision for the chip company. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.
